clinicalDescription: Overview: A disease of the small blood vessels. This term encompassess drug induced microangiopathy, primary thrombotic microangiopathy syndrome, cardiac microangiopathy. Presentation: Diarrhea (if caused by shiga toxin); Assessment: biopsy (usually of kidney) may show small-vessel platelet microthrombi (blood clots). CBC especially platelet count, LDH, evaluate for shiga toxin (especially in the presence of hemolytic uremic syndrome), serum creatinine, urine output daily. Plan: Treatment of underlyng condition, plasma exchange, or anti-complement therapy. revascularization for cardiac microangiopathy. platelet transfusion for severe thrombocytopenia, red blood cell transfusion for severe anemia. Prognosis: Poor in the absence of therapy, including myocardial ischemia, renal failure.
